intro: Melampyrum chinense, commonly known as Chinese touch-me-not, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its erect stems and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. It typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. Its leaves are opposite and oval-shaped, with a slightly hairy texture.
